EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Early Bird Expires August 14th!
REGISTER NOW! <https://2015.event.springone2gx.com/register>
Register now <https://2015.event.springone2gx.com/register> for the early bird rate by August 14th and save $150.00 off a regular conference ticket. Pivotal <http://pivotal.io>, in conjunction with the No Fluff Just Stuff Symposium Series, is pleased to present SpringOne 2GX <http://www.springone2gx.com/>, the premier Java event of 2015. SpringOne 2GX is a collocated event covering the Spring, Groovy and Grails ecosystems, with full tracks on Big Data and Cloud Native Applications. The conference will be held September 14 - 17, 2015 at the Marriott Marquis in Washington DC.
FEATURED SESSION WITH JOSH LONG Getting Started with Spring Cloud <https://2015.event.springone2gx.com/schedule/sessions/getting_started_with_spring_cloud.html>
Spring Cloud 1.0 is here! It offers a powerful way to create and consume microservices. As you introduce new services, you introduce integration problems: services can be shaky, they can disappear and - as they're often exposed over HTTP - they require a bit more footwork than in-process method invocations. In this webinar, we'll focus specifically on how Spring Cloud integrates service registration (e.g.: Eureka, Consul, or Zookeeper), declarative REST clients (with Netflix's Feign), reactive programming and the circuit breaker pattern with Hystrix to support easy, robust service-to-service invocations. This is a deep dive on how to make connect and consume microservices, and is a natural next step after my introduction to building microservices with Spring Cloud.
Pre-Conference Training by Pivotal Education
Pivotal Education offers a series of accelerated, hands-on training workshops prior to the SpringOne conference. Sessions are scheduled two full days before the conference begins (September 13-14) and provide students with an opportunity to receive in-depth training on some of the latest Pivotal technologies. Courses run from 9 a.m. - 5 p.m. both days. Sessions will not overlap with any conference activities. Training workshops are $400 per student. Price includes 2-day training workshop and $50 gift card (to be allocated for breakfast, lunch and breaks during the 2 days) Your preferred workshop can be selected during registration for SpringOne 2GX. Space is limited.
Course #1: Developing Applications with Cloud Foundry Course #2: Spring XD
Course #3: Building the Connected Car
Click here for course details <http://springone2gx.com/training>
Marriott Marquis Hotel 901 Massachusetts Avenue NW
Washington, District Of Columbia 20001 USA [map <https://www.google.com/maps/place/Marriott+Marquis+Washington,+Washington,+DC+20001/@38.9036283,-77.0247219,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x89b7b792e03c44d1:0xbbfcef3a3f4dfa2>] (202) 824-9200
This is a one-of-a-kind conference for application developers, solution and data architects: people who develop business applications, create multi-device aware web applications, process vast quantities of enterprise data, design cloud architectures, and manage high performance infrastructure. The sessions are specifically tailored for developers using the popular open source Spring IO Projects, Groovy & Grails, Cloud Foundry, RabbitMQ, Redis, Geode, Hadoop and Tomcat technologies. Whether you're building mission-critical web or business applications, crunching huge amounts of distributed data, or designing the next killer cloud application, SpringOne 2GX will keep you up to date with the latest enterprise technology.
Featuring presentations delivered by development leads, committers, customers, and published authors, it's the ideal place to obtain critical skills to help you design, build and run tomorrow's software solutions. Plus you'll meet and learn from open source leaders who drive innovation for these technologies.
Check our website <http://springone2gx.com> for speaker and session updates, and mark your calendar now!
See you there, The Spring Team at Pivotal <http://www.pivotal.io>
